cons: doesn't pay much but that's Virginia I suppose

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Lexington, VA
pros: Not only are the health benefits great there are other benefits for full-time employees once you have been employed for a certain amount of time that is really great as well. These include a computer purchase program as well as Home Loan Program!
cons: Depending on the department you work in and your boss will really dictate how much you enjoy your job.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in New York, NY
pros: Individual Private Office work space
cons: Unethical behavior towards new faculty

review_title: Nice people, smart students, plenty of money for student and professional development
pros:
-Most people here are very nice, and the staff is competent. 
-Students are bright, though some could work harder.
-There are numerous small purses for summer research students, additional stipends, conference travel, visiting speakers, and entertainment.  If you need to do something good for students or your professional development, there is money/time/opportunity for it, and that is quite fulfilling.
cons:
-People are people, and some influential people (at least in my stay) are passive-aggressive, secretive, manipulative, or dishonest in some way.    
-Tiny town.

review_title: Was funded to conduct valuable research
pros: Very flexible hours, great atmosphere, cheap cost of living, the job I had will prove to be very helpful in starting a career in a similar area to the research I got funded to work on while working here.
cons: Lexington is not the most interesting place on earth, the work gets a bit redundant, sometimes research advisor was very busy with other projects

review_title: As a research analyst, you are given the freedom to operate and have great access to Professors and other resources
pros: Definitely a worthwhile resume builder and a good opportunity to see what lab work would be like full time. The hours for research work are flexible, depending on your Professor, and can be very self driven.
cons: Sometimes the lack of structure made it difficult to feel like you were accomplishing meaningful goals.

pros: Good benefits; Low Cost of Living; Small Class Size
cons: University is located literally out of nowhere. It can be extremely boring to stay in Lexington. Although it is a liberal arts university, it still is predominantly white particularly with respect to faculty. W&L needs to really work on being truly inclusive, diverse and welcoming of minorities and international faculty.

pros: Honor Code, and the general accountability understanding that results. People are given the freedom to work as they see fit as long a job is done and done well.
cons: Sometimes the students can be outrageous. But most are very respectful. And obviously, being a college campus, jobs vary far and wide, service jobs will differ vastly from administrative.

pros: Very friendly work environment that caters to the needs of the individual with a family.  Absolutely gorgeous area of the country, as it is nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains of the Shenandoah Valley in southern Virginia.
cons: Pay could be higher, especially with the tuition that is charged to the students.

job_title: Professor of Practice in Alexandria, VA
pros:
Law school deans and leadership are supportive of faculty
Great opportunities for scholarship and creativity
cons: School has dropped in U.S. News rankings and there has been some turnover, but it will recover

job_title: R E Lee Research Scholar in Lexington, VA
pros: Gained real world experience through hands on research in an environment that was designed to support and grow my mind.
cons: Interaction with others left me desiring more human contact. It was a very isolated community with little to do outside of work.

pros: great pay, great time off, interesting opportunities

review_title: I love this school and everything about it, small time life for big city folks.

pros: Great opportunities for student employment within academic departments and staff, friendly offices and nice facilities
cons: Work study jobs can be mundane, you're often paid to wait around to be told what to do. Lots of copymaking and the like.

review_title: Great Salary but in a remote location

cons: It is in a remote location of Virginia and there is a lack of diversity on campus
